private_information: Expert in abstracting action schemas from natural language
Knows how to normalize predicate and action symbols consistently across a model
action_modeler.goal: Extract precise action schemas (parameters, preconditions, add and delete effects) from public information without emitting PDDL, and resolve symbol consistency issues.

private_information: Expert in compiling initial states and goals into structured scenarios
Able to derive soft ordering hints from sample plans to aid orchestration
state_estimator.goal: Compile the initial states, goals, object universe, and any available plan fragments into a structured, solver-ready scenario description without emitting PDDL.

private_information: Coordinates the agents and compiles the final planning model
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the action schemas and scenarios to produce a valid PDDL domain and problem files compatible with the Fast Downward solver.

public_information: There are six actions over a single object type: paltry(?a ?b ?c), sip(?a ?b ?c), clip(?a ?b ?c), wretched(?a ?b ?c ?d), memory(?a ?b ?c), and tightfisted(?a ?b ?c).
Preconditions and effects: paltry requires hand ?a, cats ?b, texture ?c, vase ?a ?b, and next ?b ?c; it adds next ?a ?c and deletes vase ?a ?b.
Preconditions and effects: sip requires hand ?a, cats ?b, texture ?c, next ?a ?c, and next ?b ?c; it adds vase ?a ?b and deletes next ?a ?c.
Preconditions and effects: clip requires hand ?a, sneeze ?b, texture ?c, next ?b ?c, and next ?a ?c; it adds vase ?a ?b and deletes next ?a ?c.
Preconditions and effects: wretched requires sneeze ?a, texture ?b, texture ?c, stupendous ?d, next ?a ?b, collect ?b ?d, and collect ?c ?d; it adds next ?a ?c and deletes next ?a ?b.
Preconditions and effects: memory requires cats ?a, spring ?b, spring ?c, and next ?a ?b; it adds next ?a ?c and deletes next ?a ?b.
Preconditions and effects: tightfisted requires hand ?a, sneeze ?b, texture ?c, next ?b ?c, and vase ?a ?b; it adds next ?a ?c and deletes vase ?a ?b.

Scenario 1 initial facts include cats object_0; collect object_5 object_1; collect object_6 object_1; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_2; hand object_10; hand object_11; hand object_12; hand object_9; next object_0 object_5; next object_10 object_7; next object_11 object_8; next object_12 object_5; next object_3 object_6; next object_4 object_8; next object_9 object_8; sneeze object_3; sneeze object_4; spring object_5; spring object_7; stupendous object_1; stupendous object_2; texture object_5; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8.
Scenario 1 goal facts: next object_10 object_8, next object_11 object_6, next object_12 object_8, next object_9 object_5.
Scenario 1 sample plan is provided as an ordered list of grounded actions.

Scenario 2 initial facts include cats object_0; cats object_1; collect object_6 object_2; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_3; collect object_9 object_3; hand object_10; hand object_11; hand object_12; hand object_13; next object_0 object_6; next object_1 object_6; next object_10 object_9; next object_11 object_8; next object_12 object_9; next object_13 object_6; next object_4 object_7; next object_5 object_9; sneeze object_4; sneeze object_5; spring object_6; spring object_8; stupendous object_2; stupendous object_3; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9.
Scenario 2 goal facts: next object_10 object_6, next object_11 object_9, next object_12 object_7, next object_13 object_9.

extract_actions.system_prompt: You transform natural language action descriptions into a precise, symbol-preserving action schema catalog without emitting PDDL.
extract_actions.prompt: Your name is action_modeler. From the following public information and structured catalog of actions {environment->init->actions} and predicates {environment->init->predicates}, produce a concise, unambiguous ACTIONS_SPEC that lists for each action its parameters, preconditions, add_effects, and del_effects with the exact symbols provided. Do not output PDDL; use a readable structured format that the orchestrator can map to PDDL directly.

normalize_symbols.system_prompt: You ensure consistent naming for actions, parameters, and predicates across all artifacts.
normalize_symbols.prompt: Given the ACTIONS_SPEC you created, output a SYMBOL_TABLE that maps each action and predicate name to itself and lists canonical parameter names per operator so that orchestrator can reuse the exact same symbols. Include a short list of integrity checks (e.g., arity for vase, next, collect).

compile_scenarios.system_prompt: You compile initial states and goals into structured scenarios without emitting PDDL.
compile_scenarios.prompt: Your name is state_estimator. Using the public information, construct SCENARIOS_SPEC for {environment->init->scenarios} with the exact object universe {environment->init->objects}. For each scenario include: name, objects, initial_facts, goal_facts. Preserve symbol spelling exactly. Do not output PDDL.

plan_hints.system_prompt: You extract soft ordering and relevance hints from any provided sample plans.
plan_hints.prompt: From Scenario 1's sample plan in {environment->init->scenarios}, extract ORDERING_HINTS such as frequently co-occurring action pairs and precondition-support relationships that might help validate operator semantics. Do not emit PDDL; provide only hints.

synthesize_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL and the Fast Downward solver. You will produce a PDDL domain and at least one PDDL problem that can be solved by Fast Downward. You must enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and each PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
synthesize_pddl.prompt: Integrate the ACTIONS_SPEC, SYMBOL_TABLE, SCENARIOS_SPEC, and ORDERING_HINTS to produce a consistent STRIPS-style PDDL domain (no typing required) and problem instances targeting the Fast Downward solver. Use exactly these predicate and action names: hand, cats, sneeze, spring, stupendous, texture, collect, next, vase; actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted. If multiple scenarios are present, prefer generating a problem for scenario_2; include scenario_1 as an additional problem if feasible. Keep the object set to {environment->init->objects}. Ensure effects include both add and delete lists as specified. Output format: one <domain> ... </domain> followed by one or more <problem> ... </problem>. Provide models only; do not include explanations.
